children.value: is an irrational number using proof by contradiction. That is, we will assume that it is a rational number and show that this assumption creates a consequence that is contradictory to our assumption.

Note that the partial sums remaining on the right-hand side sum to 0.193, which is not an integer. In fact, the larger the value of

children.html: q!q!q!

, the smaller the partial sum on the right-hand side will be (and will always be

children.html: <1< 1<1

children.value: ). So it is easy to see the contradiction here — you cannot have one side of an equation be an integer and the other be a non-integer.
